column4: HAPPENING NOW: My guests and I are live for an update on #COVID19. Tune in at the links below⬇️ https://t.co/4Li2ZddHv0

TODAY AT 3PM: Don't miss my live discussion on #COVID19 with Dr. Josh Sharfstein (@JohnsHopkinsSPH) and Beth Anne Langrell (@4allseasonsinc). We'll answer questions on public health guidance, behavioral & mental health care, and keeping our communities safe in the months ahead https://t.co/yJsilk4nZH

The White House claims #COVID19 as a victory despite spikes in cases nationwide and 200,000+ deaths. Instead of prioritizing a relief package to get states & medical workers more funds for testing, PPE & medical equipment, @POTUS and Republicans rushed through a SCOTUS nomination https://t.co/FaoHtJaP9L

ICYMI: My conversation with @WashingtonPost Live on helping small businesses through #COVID19. Congress can't wait any longer to pass a comprehensive #COVID19 economic relief bill to help #SmallBiz owners keep their doors open and pay their employees.
https://t.co/h2osz4Q8zo
Have a question about #COVID19 health and safety? Ask our experts. Click below to submit your question to be answered during the live Q&A. https://t.co/Sw1Zskko7W

THURSDAY: I'm going live for an update on #COVID19 in Maryland. I'll be joined by Josh Sharfstein (@JohnsHopkinsSPH) and Beth Anne Langrell (@4allseasonsinc) for an update on staying safe and keeping our communities healthy in the months ahead. https://t.co/tw1u45KmqY

Judge Barrett's nomination is a clear attack on the #ACA. Republicans want to strip away health care for millions of Americans & protections for people with preexisting conditions in the middle of a pandemic. The Senate must not move forward with this confirmation. #WhatsAtStake https://t.co/5qCaN7VtGE

I'm on the Senate floor speaking against Judge Barrett's nomination and the GOP's attempt to rush this process to undercut health care and rights for millions of Americans. #WhatsAtStake

WATCH LIVE⬇️
https://t.co/6YZdbwR7RU

I voted no on advancing Judge Barrett’s nomination today. Republicans have abandoned precedent & principle to ram through this confirmation, putting health care & fundamental rights for millions on the line.

The American people deserve better than this. #WhatsAtStake

Next week: Join me for a live update on #COVID19. My guests & I will answer your questions on how to stay safe in the winter months ahead and how everyone – including Congress – can take action to keep our communities healthy. 

Submit your question HERE➡️https://t.co/Sw1Zskko7W https://t.co/ivm7M90fDg

A reminder of #WhatsAtStake: The #ACA is a lifeline for Marylanders like Don. They shouldn't have to worry that they won't be able to afford the life-saving procedures they need because Republicans want to ram through their #SCOTUS nominee to take away their health care. https://t.co/jxCCxNCYpL

The GOP proposal isn't enough. #SmallBiz & their employees need more than just PPP to get through the pandemic. 

This bill invests in vulnerable industries like restaurants, concert venues & theaters while providing assistance to minority-owned & underserved businesses at risk.

Today is #ImagineADayWithoutWater. More than 2 million Americans are living without basic access to safe drinking water & sanitation. Especially during #COVID19, lack of access puts lives & our public health at risk. 

We must always invest in clean water for all. #ValueWater https://t.co/ygKkB0yMRB

In March, my colleagues & I called on the Trump admin to reverse this proposal. We must now keep fighting to make nutrition assistance more accessible for families in need- that means passing #COVID19 relief to expand SNAP benefits & access to healthy food.https://t.co/jJQ9jUKDwf

.@POTUS wants to cut SNAP benefits for low-income Americans even as #COVID19 is causing a rise in unemployment and food insecurity. 

Yesterday a federal judge ruled to block this plan. https://t.co/LWyCAVAAOb

Food shortages, movement restrictions and loss of incomes due to #COVID19 have exacerbated the global hunger crisis.
#WorldFoodDay calls upon the international community to come together in the fight to end food insecurity worldwide. 
https://t.co/D17nTF7t1u
RT @HealthyMaryland: Marylander Barbara Gruber is sharing her story about the difference the Affordable Care Act has made in her life. “It…

TOMORROW: Join me for a conversation on the ACA's impact on Maryland residents & #WhatsAtStake if SCOTUS rules to repeal it. I'll hear from health care professionals Salliann Alborn & Dr. Willarda Edwards, and individuals who've been helped by the ACA. https://t.co/u1JCsGO8GY

HCC's legacy is a reminder of why we must continue to invest in our community colleges - especially during #COVID19. We have a relief bill that will get funds to colleges, state & local govts, and students working to stay afloat and get their education. We need to pass it today.

By rushing the #SCOTUS nomination, Senate Republicans are turning their backs on Americans and putting people’s health care on the line for their own partisan interests. 

Americans need access to affordable care, medications & lifesaving services, especially now during #COVID19.

Judge Barrett has sided against the #ACA before. If Senate Republicans continue to ram through her nomination before the ACA lawsuit is heard in front of #SCOTUS on November 10, more than 20 million Americans could lose their health care. 

This is #WhatsAtStake.

Health care for 133 million Americans w/ preexisting conditions - including the millions who survived #COVID19 - would be at risk if Republicans confirm their #SCOTUS nominee & repeal the ACA. 

That's #WhatsAtStake. We can't let them take away access to affordable, quality care.

How did gaining health coverage or patient protections from the #ACA change your life?

How would you & your family be affected if Republicans confirm their #SCOTUS nominee and repeal the ACA? 

Share your story. Tell us #WhatsAtStake for your health care:
https://t.co/JeE5lVrQNb

#WhatsAtStake if Republicans confirm their #SCOTUS nominee & overturn the #ACA? Health care for more than 20 million Americans. 

If this includes you, I want to share your story. Click here to send a short video or comment on what the ACA means to you https://t.co/JeE5lVrQNb

This is shameful. By halting funds for state & local govts, schools, unemployment insurance, testing resources and small business support to push through his SCOTUS nominee, @POTUS is telling Americans that their health and stability are not his priority. https://t.co/FWjMEnI1T6

On #WorldTeachersDay we thank all the educators who go above & beyond to make learning possible - online & in-person - for students through #COVID19. I'll keep fighting until Congress provides them with the resources they need to do their jobs effectively and keep our kids safe.

Now's the time to strengthen our national #COVID19 response and get individuals, schools, and state & local govts resources to combat this disease. The House passed the updated #HeroesAct yesterday. Americans need help now — we can’t wait any longer to pass this relief package.

#COVID19 is a serious disease, and no one is immune. We must all work together to slow the spread and protect one another.

Please continue to take precautions, wear a mask, social distance, and follow the guidance of our public health experts.

With this continuing resolution, the government will remain open, but a CR is no substitute for full appropriations & emergency funding to meet the needs of Americans facing hardship due to #COVID19. Congress must come together to fully fund our government
https://t.co/9vhZySZebM

Everyone deserves control over their bodies, their health care & their future - that's why access to contraception is so important.
 
On #WorldContraceptionDay we must commit to ending the admin's #GlobalGagRule which threatens the right to family planning for millions worldwide.

#COVID19 has claimed more than 200,000 American lives, yet the admin continues to disregard public health guidance while @senatemajldr stands in the way of a comprehensive relief package.

Keeping Americans safe must be our top priority. The Senate must pass #COVID19 relief now.

Guidance from our experts and scientists saves lives. The administration must not stand in the way of information that could help our communities continue to fight the spread of #COVID19 https://t.co/ggjGCmlL1k

The GOP's #COVID19 relief bill failed in the Senate because it failed to provide support for the families, small businesses and state & local govts affected by the pandemic. We must work together to pass a bipartisan bill to respond to this national crisis.https://t.co/zju4dFdk4u

The Trump admin continues to push to reopen schools w/o investing resources to keep students and educators safe, w/o a national testing plan that would help our communities combat #COVID19. 

We can't put our kids and teachers at risk – we must continue to fight for their safety.
The GOP plan fails to address these challenges. We need real relief, not paper-thin proposals that mostly reallocate funds previously designated for #COVID relief.

Happy #LaborDay! Today we celebrate the resilience of the American workforce. This year we're especially grateful for the millions of essential workers who have continued to provide care for our citizens and keep our nation running through the #COVID19 pandemic.

America’s small businesses are already dealing with the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic. Now they have been left to deal with the consequences of @POTUS and Postmaster General Dejoy's attacks on @USPS operations. My colleagues and I are demanding answers. https://t.co/iRPrtyIyMe

I joined my colleagues in calling on @USDA to extend school meal waivers through the 2020-2021 school year.

For many kids, school lunches may be the only regular meals they receive. We must ensure schools have the flexibility they need to feed our students as #COVID19 continues. https://t.co/cIQLbCBFVm

Your response to the #2020Census helps to secure federal funds for schools, hospitals, roads, public works and other vital programs for your community.

Do your part by visiting https://t.co/bok9OzdhaO TODAY and filling out your Census form as soon as possible. #GetCounted

Yet again, the Trump administration is putting politics before the advice of our public health experts.

Undermining the CDC and ignoring science-based guidance poses a threat to our public health and puts more lives in danger. https://t.co/cGKVlWYU9z

HAPPENING NOW: Tune in as I join @JHconnects for a virtual town hall on Small Business relief during #COVID19. 

Watch live and join the discussion on Facebook now: https://t.co/GoXSlJx533 https://t.co/HAmBP1tDlm

This Friday, August 21, I'm going live with @JHConnects for a virtual town hall on #COVID19 relief for our nation's small businesses. Click below to sign up and join our live discussion. https://t.co/HAmBP1tDlm
This pandemic is not over. The only way we'll get through it is by working together. Protect yourself and others by wearing a mask to prevent the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/poK8rk8bUp

Great news: @MarylandConnect has reopened the #COVID19 emergency Special Enrollment Period. If you didn't get a chance to sign up for a health care plan last time around, you now have until December 15, 2020 to get covered. Visit https://t.co/6cgxxksCsz to enroll today.

Starting Soon: Tune in live at 4 pm for my discussion with @DrLeanaWen and Dr. Stephen Thomas (@umdhealthequity) on Racial Disparities and #COVID19.

Watch on Facebook at https://t.co/kSBetVJXpv or YouTube at https://t.co/9ungOv0C5h

Looking forward to this virtual discussion with @DrLeanaWen and Dr. Stephen Thomas (@umdhealthequity) on Racial Disparities and #COVID19.

Tune in live tomorrow at 4 pm at https://t.co/kSBetVJXpv and https://t.co/0dASCxqocl to join the conversation. https://t.co/XDsZ6uu1if

Cutting the Census risks a severe undercount in communities nationwide — particularly among immigrants & people of color. 

Especially as we combat #COVID19, threatening representation & federal resources for historically underrepresented groups would be detrimental to our nation

Mail-in voting is safe and secure and a necessary option to ensure Americans can exercise their right this November while staying safe from #COVID19
https://t.co/rkMY027suD

This World Day against Trafficking in Persons, I stand with victims of trafficking and those who fight to end it in all its forms. 

As #COVID19 increases global insecurity, we must work to protect vulnerable groups, support survivors and #EndHumanTrafficking wherever it hides.

Save the date: Next Thursday, August 6, I'm going live on Facebook and YouTube for a conversation on Racial Disparities and #COVID19.

Join the conversation! Reply below or visit https://t.co/kSBetVJXpv to submit your questions. A select few will be answered during the live Q&A. https://t.co/J4b3tYimQB

State and local govts are facing tough decisions on how to maintain essential services like education, public health, and public safety with budget shortfalls due to #COVID19. We can't move forward with a plan that fails to include funds needed to keep local communities afloat. https://t.co/L2QVZvuY24

There isn’t enough money to help states and local governments manage the fallout from a pandemic, but we can backfill where the president stole money from military projects for his border wall? #whatweretheythinking https://t.co/NSmx4k2miS
Learn more about the COVID-19 Health Disparities Action Act here➡️https://t.co/Z2CkD4JThE

It couldn't be more clear or more urgent.

We can't address #COVID19 without addressing racial inequities in health care and treatment - our bill creates a plan to do just that. https://t.co/0VPmHtvR9H
We all agree that the #FBI needs a new headquarters, but to suddenly slip in this ill-suited and unworkable downtown proposal as part of a COVID-19 relief package is the height of absurdity.

Rent is due in a week and millions of Americans impacted by this economic crisis are facing eviction. Extending the federal eviction moratorium and expanding it to cover all renters in need of assistance must be our top priority as we negotiate the next #COVID19 relief package.

As we celebrate #ADAat30, we must also recommit ourselves to building a more inclusive world and ensuring equal protection & opportunity for all people with disabilities in every aspect of society, including employment, housing, health services & much more https://t.co/9Y58ilLaP0

In Maryland, African Americans & Latinos account for 40.6% and 25.9% of #COVID19 deaths, respectively, despite making up just 30% and 10% of the state’s population. To end this crisis, we must address long-standing systemic racism in medical research, testing & care.

Yesterday, I introduced the #COVID19 Health Disparities Action Act w @SenatorMenendez to ensure that our public health response efforts will address the needs of communities of color hit hardest by #COVID19 https://t.co/Z2CkD4JThE

My colleagues and I are calling on the admin to reverse the changes to CDC #COVID19 data reporting. The American public, hospitals and state & local governments depend on access to reliable & accurate data to respond to this crisis & keep citizens safe. 
https://t.co/SdV1LGzouC

Undermining the @CDCgov and hiding medical data will not make #COVID19 go away - it will make it even harder for everyone to make informed decisions on how to respond to this crisis, putting even more lives in danger. 
 
Transparency is critical to saving lives. https://t.co/wnC5ZJ8vuP

HAPPENING SOON: I'm going live at 2 pm with Tonya Sweat of @MarylandPTA and Cheryl Bost of @MSEAeducators to discuss school reopenings during #COVID19.

Tune in at https://t.co/kSBetVJXpv or https://t.co/0dASCxqocl https://t.co/p1jzpNy0kl

If you still need to file for 2019, visit https://t.co/E6V0YIx3EY now for more information. #TaxDay

Marylanders: @MarylandConnect's #COVID19 special enrollment period ends TODAY. Visit https://t.co/2MZaVIY7Nd now to sign up for a plan or make changes to your existing coverage. #GetCoveredMD https://t.co/L3mjkPLTvV

Public health guidance must drive the decision to reopen schools - not threats from the admin to withhold funding. 

With rising infection rates, it's irresponsible to bring kids & educators back to the classroom without a plan to protect everyone’s safety https://t.co/f1lEwPukyw

We should be making voting easier and safer for Americans through the #COVID19 crisis. Gov. Hogan’s plan to limit access to mail-in ballots and hold in-person elections as usual risks both voter turn-out and public health.

He must reverse this guidance.
https://t.co/exrOTqSZAl

THURSDAY: I’ll be hosting a live conversation with Tonya Sweat of @MarylandPTA & Cheryl Bost of @MSEAeducators on getting Maryland students back to school safely through the #COVID19 outbreak.

Join the discussion! Reply to submit a question to be answered during the Q&A. https://t.co/zSwWjPAH12

While @POTUS tweets, Maryland universities are hard at work battling #COVID19. Our university hospital systems are providing care for #COVID19 patients, creating internationally utilized mapping data, & conducting important research to combat this disease. These threats must end. https://t.co/ELlQwerGyz

Bringing federal employees back to the office prematurely could further increase the risk of spreading #COVID19 in the National Capital Region.

To protect the health and safety of employees and our communities, the admin. must allow telework to continue.
https://t.co/nlvBDRsO09

.@POTUS shouldn't be bullying states to reopen schools against public health recommendations. 

We all want students to be able to return to school this fall, but we must do this in a way that will put the safety of our children, teachers and communities first. https://t.co/l3cQ22gy7L

This #SCOTUS decision upholds another Trump administration attack on reproductive care and women’s health. Everyone deserves access to affordable contraception - employers and universities shouldn’t be able to deny coverage or make reproductive decisions for their workers. https://t.co/idB6reUTKJ

Attempts by @POTUS to command schools into reopening fails to take any local public health concerns into account or the true costs for local school systems to safely reopen. These include retaining personnel, addl cleaning supplies and PPE, technology, and broadband for students.

Uprooting international students during a pandemic is especially cruel. This xenophobic policy leaves thousands of students with uncertainty about their futures & their education while undermining our universities and higher education system – it must be reversed immediately. https://t.co/dw8MA2FAvK

This is a welcome step - #PPPLoan data will help inform Congress as we work to provide additional support to small businesses harmed by #COVID19, especially those in underserved communities. https://t.co/bbyw92TQrP.

We're still in the midst of the #COVID19 crisis. As we head into the July 4th holiday weekend, remember to continue to do everything you can to protect yourself and others: 

✅Wear your mask
✅Wash your hands 
✅Avoid crowds and stay 6 feet apart from other people

#COVID19 hardships will not stop because of a deadline. Small businesses will need continued support to stay afloat. That’s why we introduced the P4 Act. Extending the #PPPLoan deadline means more businesses can get the funds they need to recover. https://t.co/V3GHG511NO

State & local govts have been hit hard by #COVID19, but Gov. Hogan’s drastic budget cuts are premature and would put essential services & state employees on the frontlines of this crisis at risk. We must do everything possible to protect workers & the services citizens rely on. https://t.co/vmS9MjWlV0

This #SCOTUS decision is a victory for reproductive rights - but the fight is far from over. Access to women’s health care is still under attack and we must continue to work to expand and protect reproductive freedom nationwide. https://t.co/pRNReZLmVm

The Trump Admin has filed a legal brief asking #SCOTUS to end the #ACA, threatening coverage for millions of Americans. Health care should be affordable & accessible for all - especially as we face a public health & economic crisis. We won't give up the fight to #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/N1O0F2PWgx

DC shouldn’t have to fight for the same amount of #COVID19 relief funds states receive; they shouldn't be unable to contest the deployment of the national guard within their own borders. Statehood will give these taxpaying residents the voice & equality our democracy guarantees.

Slowing testing isn’t a solution to #COVID19 . It will make us less safe and it will put lives at risk. For Trump to make such a claim as experts and state officials continue to call for increased testing support nationwide is not only irresponsible but dangerous. https://t.co/lSXtTOaGg2

Voting by mail is secure and safe and especially necessary during this public health crisis. Trump’s insistence on pushing this dangerous myth threatens the participation of all citizens in our democracy – regardless of party affiliation. https://t.co/GJ2xOpDl99

This week SCOTUS ruled to end workplace discrimination for the LGBTQIA+ community. There's more work to be done to stop discrimination in other areas of life like housing, education, health care. Congress must take up the #EqualityAct to finally guarantee full equality for all.

.@POTUS has been on a dangerous mission to take away access to health care from Americans who need it the most. .@POTUS once again has failed to lead. He continuously fans the flames of racism and seeks to divide Americans for political purposes. He seems blind to the reason people are protesting in the first place: to end the repeated and tragic targeting of blacks by law enforcement.

Today we mourn the loss of 100,000+ Americans and 2,431 Marylanders to #COVID19.

We mourn with all who've lost parents, grandparents, children, friends & valued members of our communities.

Through our continued fight against this pandemic, we must never forget their memory. https://t.co/btcC3liJsH

Withdrawing from WHO will have serious consequences for our nation & the global fight against #COVID19. Plus, abandoning US leadership still leaves room for China to expand its influence - exactly what @POTUS claims he wants to stop. 

This is counterproductive & will cost lives. https://t.co/U43QJx0Gnz

I applaud the tireless work of our medical workers, health professionals and researchers to save lives, find a cure and slow the spread of this disease. We must continue to stay safe, listen to experts and support our frontline workers – our lives depend on it.

We will be living with the effects of #COVID19 for years to come – we will continue to adapt to new ways to learn, work, and live as we overcome this crisis. But the tremendous loss of life is a pain we will endure as a nation.

My heart breaks for the 100,000 Americans lost to #COVID19 and for all who have had to say goodbye to their friends, family & loved ones from a distance. 
 
They are more than numbers. As we mourn we must remember that this global crisis is deeply personal for those affected. https://t.co/Y3qQUNmQyc

.@POTUS' 4th of July parade is a danger to public health & waste of taxpayer money. As Maryland, DC & Virginia suffer some of the worst impacts of #COVID19, such a massive event is irresponsible & risks the safety of residents & service members who may be forced to participate. https://t.co/dlQwHWdEh6

 !  We'll be sharing info all throughout #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth

Mental health is just as important as physical health. I encourage Marylanders to visit @NamiMaryland at https://t.co/hLjCGblJda for resources on care, treatment and support during these difficult times. #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth

May is #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth. As rates of anxiety, depression, substance abuse & domestic violence rise due to the #COVID19 crisis, it's more important than ever to #FundMentalHealth and redouble our efforts to expand services for all those in need.

https://t.co/8IFRan5BVZ

Our experts have said over and over again: testing is key to saving lives and reopening our states.

We must increase testing capacity in all communities before we get back to business as usual or we risk further endangering our citizens and our economy. https://t.co/gZpZjzoZ4H
